course_title: Senior Seminar: Civil Rights and Basketball
class_notes:
Tuesdays, 5:30-7:30 pm Class Dates: 1/30, 2/6, 2/13, 2/20, 2/27, alternate date: 3/5


Seminar Description:  The course will cover the earliest days of the game and how the African American community embraced and helped grow the game. As the Civil Rights Movement took hold, the game benefited, but it also contributed to the advancement of equal rights for all. As different leagues started and stopped, eventually the two most substantial organizations merged to form the NBA   The course will trace the history of the NBA from 1946 to its current state and the racial strife it endured along the way.
course_description: Senior seminar courses fall outside the scope of traditional academic coursework, and instead allow students to learn from and interact with experienced practitioners, and to develop industry-specific insights, fine-tune career skills, and increase professional exposure.
